sections.â„¹ï¸: Visual representations of users or entities, typically displayed as circular images. They support various sizes, fallback options, and can include additional features like badges.

sections.â„¹ï¸ Info: The Avatar Group component efficiently displays multiple avatars together, representing a collection of users or entities. It typically features a horizontal layout with overlapping or adjacent avatars. This component is ideal for visualizing teams, collaborators, or any group of users in a compact, visually appealing manner.

sections.â„¹ï¸: Small visual indicators used to display numeric values, status, or notifications. They typically appear near other UI elements and use color and shape to convey meaning.
Breadcrumbs show users their current location in a site's hierarchy and enable quick navigation to parent levels. They're typically displayed as a horizontal list of links.
Interactive elements that trigger actions when clicked. They support different styles, states, and can include icons or text.
Compact buttons that display only an icon, often used for common actions where space is limited.
Minimal button style that appears as clickable text without a visible container.

Hybrid component that combines the functionality of a link (navigation) with the appearance of a button. Used for actions that navigate to a new page or resource while maintaining a button-like appearance.
Checkboxes allow users to select one or more options from a list. They support states like checked, unchecked, and indeterminate (partial).
Checkboxes allow users to select one or more options from a list. They support states like checked, unchecked, and indeterminate (partial).
Input fields allow users to enter and edit text. They can support various types of input (e.g., text, number, email) and often include labels and validation.
Input fields allow users to enter and edit text. They can support various types of input (e.g., text, number, email) and often include labels and validation.
Input fields allow users to enter and edit text. They can support various types of input (e.g., text, number, email) and often include labels and validation.
multi-line text input field designed for longer form content.
Component, also known as a dropdown or select menu, allows users to choose one option from a predefined list.

Pagination helps users navigate through large sets of data or content divided into pages. It typically includes controls to move between pages and often shows the current page and total number of pages.
Also known as Dot Indicators or Dot Navigation, is a component used to represent and navigate through a series of pages or slides.
Radio buttons allow users to select a single option from a group of mutually exclusive choices. They are typically used when there are 2-7 options.
Radio buttons allow users to select a single option from a group of mutually exclusive choices. They are typically used when there are 2-7 options.
Interactive control that allows users to select a single option from a set of mutually exclusive choices.
Slots are placeholders in components that can be filled with custom content, allowing for greater component flexibility and customization.
Scroll bars allow users to scroll through content that exceeds the visible area. They can be vertical or horizontal and often auto-hide when not needed

sections.How to use:: To extend or minimize the scroll bar use the horizontal and vertical padding of the auto-layout located in the right panel.

sections.â„¹ï¸: Search components allow users to enter queries to find content.
Search components allow users to enter queries to find content.

Module Tabs are used to quickly navigate between views within the same context.

sections.â„¹ï¸: Individual interactive element within a Tabs component that represents a specific view or section of content.
Individual interactive element within a Tabs component that represents a specific view or section of content.
Specialized variant of the Tag component that allows users to interact with it, typically for applying and managing dynamic data, filtering, or categorization.
Compact UI element used for labeling, categorizing, or providing metadata about content.
Informative UI element that displays additional text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element.
Component that allows users to switch between two mutually exclusive states, typically representing on/off or true/false.
